column4: i i am trying to set up file sharing using this http://senk9.wordpress.com/2010/09/26/how-to-stream-media-onto-your-android-device-easily-from-anywhere/  the 2 ip address i get from ifconfig and http://www.whatismyip.com dont work
are you file sharing on a local network?
yes using the tutorial from ^ i mentioned
ifconfig would show internal / whatismyip.com would show external.
if you read what i said ^ both do not work
you could be getting the wrong IP from ifconig.
he was helping you.. if both IP's aren't working, you're obviously doing something wrong.. so he was obviously covering the steps.
pastebin your ifconfig -a, and someone will tell you the 'correct' one to use.
yes i did that the oip address from ifconfig wlan0 is not working
can you ping your android devices internal IP (if on WiFi network?)
android dont hav a terminal i dont know how
ping it from your linux box?
do you know the internal IP? if not.. you can probably get it from your router. Then in a terminal type "ping I.P.Address"
ok how can i get it from that idk about this
try looking in the "about this phone" settings in adroid.. it may tell you.
Settings >> Wireless Controls >> Wi-Fi Settings, it's at the bottom under "WiFi settings"
